runs.comm: leans forward to push it to cover region for a single. Ireland won the toss and chose to bowl. Two umpires are Asoka de Silva and Marais Erasmus.
Another full toss and this has been put away without much fuss. Redmond threaded the gap between mid-off and cover
full and well outside off, Redmond leaned across to slash it furiously past backward point; He flayed that.
again, too full and outside off, Redmond flashes it away but can't beat backward point this time
changes the length - drops it shorter - but the line is still well outside off, Redmond cuts to the third man boundary. Fiery start by Aaron.
over pitched and Redmond doesn't put this one away; he drove but straight to mid-off . Poor first over. Nerves, I guess.
What's happening out here. Another full and poor delivery well outside off, Redmon lashes it in the air and over cover point
full delivery, straighter but no movement and Redmond creams it between the bowler and mid-on. What a start from him. He was called into the squad to cover up for Ryder and he is on fire here.
pushes this one to wide of mid-on for a single
finally, a good delivery. It tilted in from the good length, towards the off stump, McCullum pushes it towards mid-off for a single
But when Redmond is on strike, things seem to fall apart again. This was full and on the legs, flicked away in style.
tries a slower one, ends up as a full toss and Redmond, though beaten a touch by the dip, drags it through midwicket for yet another boundary. What a cracking start.
slightly slower, outside off, pushed to cover point
length delivery around the off stump, pushed to cover. The keeper is standing up for Kevin O'Brien
high full toss on the middle, a surprised McCullum jabs it to point
turns the length delivery past midwicket for a single
beaten outside off. It held its line outside off, Redmond pushed inside the line
low full toss around off stump, flat batted to left of mid-off
drifts to the pads again and Redmond whips it through midwicket. Free gifts continue.
Redmond is unstoppable this afternoon. Or so it seems. It was a slower one, he picked it up, waited before biffing it high over mid-on
yorker on the leg stump line, dabbed to short fine-leg
low dipping full toss on the middle, attempted yorker, driven to mid-off
change of pace, slower short-of-length delivery on the middle stump line, cut down to backward point
yorker on the middle and leg, driven to cover.
length delivery on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler
mistimes a intending forcing stroke off the back foot but will pick up a single to the left of cover
bouncing from short of length, dabbed to short third man
he has had enough of staying adjacent to the line and trying to hit through the off side. So, this time, he shuffles towards off and swings the full toss high over deep square leg.
lunges forward to pick a single with a push to wide mid-off
leans forward to push it to the off side of the pitch
McCallan showed yesterday that he likes to operate from round the stumps. He starts similarly again. Full toss outside off, hit straight to cover

And he gets his man this time. Flighted from round the stumps, McCullum charged down the track, moving outside the leg and trying to drive inside-out over the off-side field but hits it straight to mid-off.
leans forward to defend to the off side
he pauses before release and floats it on the middle stump, nudged to the on side
dipping flighted delivery, defended back to the bowler
good tight wicket-taking over comes to an end. The last delivery was turned to square leg for a single.
cutting in towards the middle stump line, turned towards square leg for a single. Redmond had to run around the bowler but he gets home in time to beat the throw at the striker's end.
carves a length delivery to cover
slower one, dabbed to short third-man region for a single
lunges forward, is slightly early into the drive but adjusts by chipping it just over the bowler
short in length around off, flat-batted to long-off
back of length, skidding on towards off stump, edges the pull to his pad
floated full from round the stumps, Redmond switches around early gets into a left-hander's stance and revere sweeps over short third man

Another profitable reverse sweep. And that's his fifty. He has equaled the quickest fifty in this tournament. This time, he didn't quite get into a left-hander's stance but played the reverse sweep clear of the short third man
shuffles towards off and on drives to long-on
from over the stumps, lands it on the off stump line, driven to long-off
quicker, skidding on towards middle and off, Redmond shuffles and gets inner edge to his pad
He refuses to stop hitting. This time, the big slog sweep is out of the shelf.

Guptill goes down town. It was the slower one, it appeared as if he was beaten a touch by the change of pace but he went through with the lofted hit, taking his bottom-hand off the handle, but connected well and the ball sailed over the straight boundary
worked through midwicket for couple of runs
pushed away to the on side for a single
The long-off was slightly wide and so, Redmond drills it to the right of the fielder for yet another boundary. What a come-back he is having.
mistimes the pull but will get more runs as the man has to run in all the way from the deep
back of length outside off, biffed away towards long-off for couple more runs
full in length, moving in towards middle and off, edges the drive to the pad
full and down the leg side, rolls off the pads of the 'keeper
length delivery outside off, jabbed to left of cover for a quick single

Redmond is caught dead in front. He walked across the stumps and the ball skidded in to hit the pad. A fiery breezy knock comes to an end. Entertaining. Replays suggest it hit him outside off stump. Oh dear. I thought it was plumb. That shuffle made it look ugly i guess.. Apologies.
full again, driven down to long-on
pushed on the front foot for a single
leans across to punch to cover point
wide wide outside off and Niall had to dive full stretch to stop it
shortens the length as he spots the batsman charging out and its pushed away to the off side
short in length, cut away through point. The batsmen have a chat.
slows up the pace, tosses the conventional left-arm break full on the off stump line, driven to cover

lovely delivery that beats the bat and the 'keeper. It was well-flighted around the off stump, luring Guptill forward into a drive but the ball dipped rapidly, gripped and turned sharply past the edge and past Niall. It runs away towards third man boundary.
drops this on the blockhole, pushed out to the off side
the quicker one from front of the hand, driven to deep cover
yorker length outside off stump, squeezed out to the cover point
That's a Styris special. Full length delivery outside off and Styris slices the big hit over long-off. He stays adjacent to the line and carves it up and over
dabbed to backward point region for a single
stands up tall to punch it through covers for couple of runs
near yorker length, driven down to long-off
leans across to square drive to sweeper cover
really well up to the batsman, driven towards long-off
spins towards middle, dabbed past square leg and by the time the fielder rushes in from the deep, they take two
dropped by the bowler. It drifted in towards middle and leg before turning in, Styris was lured by the drift and chipped it to left of West who clangs it
moves outside leg, attempts a cut but doesn't connect
tossed up full on the middle, swatted past square leg
charges down the track and lifts a flighted delivery over long-off
reverse sweeps but the short third man fielder makes a diving stop
drifts away and the batsman lunges out to cover it but is beaten and Niall collects.
gets forward to drive to long-on
tossed on the middle, swept away for a single
stays back to punch it towards the non-striker and the bowler makes a diving stop
flighted full, swept to deep midwicket
gets forward to drive to long-off for a single
goes down the track, gets too close to the ball and ends up dragging it towards long-on
moves outside leg, goes for the slog sweep but West had slowed up the pace and he ends up dragging it to backward square leg
quicker, driven towards extra-cover where the fielder deflects it behind the stumps. West rushes after it, picks and fires in a throw but misses the stumps at the non-striker's end.
charges down the track, West loses composure and serves a full toss and Styris swat-pulls it over wide midwicket boundary
slows up the pace, drifts towards pads, and rolls away for a leg bye
Styris show is on. It was flatter and on the off and middle stump line, Styris went down on his knee to swing it high over deep square leg
Even better shot. He moved outside leg and lifted it inside-out to the extra-cover boundary. Superbly struck.
Kevin O'Brien takes a good catch to terminate Styris' stay. It was slog swept towards deep square leg, Kevin rushed forward and dived to take it inches off the turf.
punched through midwicket for a single
floated outside off, driven to left of extra cover where Porterfield makes a fine diving stop
low dipping full toss, going for the yorker, driven to right of long-on
moves outside leg stump. Cusack tries to push it outside off but Oram lunges across to slash it over cover point
yorker length full toss outside off, makes contact with the toe end of the bat and the ball rolls back to the bowler
fetches from outside off, mistimes the drive to long-on but that allows him to turn for the second
Smash. Cusack has been pushing it outside off, making Oram fetch it from there for his on-side hits. So this time, Oram stays still and drills it high over long-off.
Caught at deep cover. Another one full and outside off, angling away from Oram who crashes it over the off-side field but straight down the throat of the fielder.
goes for the reverse sweep first ball, connects well but the short third man fielder makes a fine diving stop
slower one, on the middle and off, nudged to left of short third man
another slower one, cutting in from a length, heaved towards wide long-on
yorker on the base of the leg stump , dug out past midwicket and since the field is well spread out, they pick up two runs!
shout for lbw as the batsman misses the reverse sweep but was struck outside the off stump. What's more, they take two leg byes
The short fine-leg was in and Peter McGlashan tried to paddle it over him. He walked towards the off stump, shaped to paddle but missed it completely. Clatter!
full in length and outside off stump, pushed away towards cover
Whack. Huge hit over long-on. Simple technique. He cleared the front foot, picked the slower one and thrashed it high over the boundary
yorker length outside off, dug out to extra cover region
pushed across outside off stump, makes contact with the toe end of the bat and the ball rolls to the off side
moves towards off stump, pushes the yorker length around the off stump to long-off
What a fine hit. It was the attempted yorker that ended up as a low full toss on the leg stump line, he took out the left leg from the line and lifted it over wide midwicket boundary
driven down to long-on
beaten by the slower one outside off stump. He was early into his big slog across the line and the 'keeper gathers.
yorker outside off, dug out weakly to the off side and the 'keeper rushes to pick it up. Franklin smashes his bat against his pad in disgust.
beaten by the slower one again but he ends up chipping it towards long-off, three men converge on the ball but none reach it

Would you believe it? Another mishit that falls safely. It was yet another slower one, Franklin, again, skies it up, this time towards long-on. The fielder rushes in from the deep but the ball falls ahead of him.
